On Tuesday, Senator Rand Paul forced a procedural vote in the Senate over whether holding an impeachment trial after Trump was no longer in office was unconstitutional.  The motion was defeated, 55 to 45.  Five Republican senators joined the Democrats to vote against dismissing the trial.  But Senator Paul is saying that this vote proves that Trump's impeachment is dead on arrival.  That's because a conviction requires 67 senators.  So if every Democrat voted to convict Trump, 17 Republicans would have to as well.
